This is a good breakfast place.  The bagels are good, the lox is tasty, and the sandwiches are plentiful.  Service is reasonably paced and there are tables both indoors and out to enjoy your meal.

Ok - i said before that this place had amazing breakfast and lunch was still good but not quite up to par....I will eat my words. I swung by today to grab a bagel sandwich or wrap and ended up doing the "create your own" and it was FANTASTIC. I ordered bacon & turkey on my sandwhich and we all know what that means - "oh they'll probably throw 1/2 a strip of bacon on there since i'm ordering 2 meats..." Nope. It was a decent pile of bacon on there and perfectly crispy. Added avocado & lettuce, tomato, & a bit if mayo. Man, I love this place!!

Small hole in the wall ... Amazing brunch place in the neighborhood.. I have tried almost all their pancakes... Fresh and yummy food... Be ready to wait in line over the weekends as it can get packed,..  But totally worth it... I recommend all their bagels and omelettes as well ...good service and great place for a family breakfast ...inside and outside seating available with ample parking :)

Some days on the way to work I will make a stop here... I order the same thing The Southwestern bagel sandwich it's always really good I would say split it with someone it's really a lot of food plus it comes with a cup of fresh fruit... It's a good start to a day I would say.

Everything about this place is great. The coffee is spectacular. The food is healthy and fresh. Customer service is great. Friendly staff that will always go the extra mile to satisfy guests. (The place gets pretty busy, so don't go in expecting speedy service during breakfast/lunch rush).

The staff is really friendly and the service was really fast! That's why I gave 3 stars. But the food was so bland and disappointing. I wanted to check this place out because it had so many good reviews but I don't know why now. I got the South Mountain Burro. Maybe their bagels are amazing. But their food? It's not something I'd come back for.
Long wait time for average food. One meal came out 10 minutes before the others' and then got a lame excuse for why the wait was so long. Go to IHOP instead, service and food are better.

For a bagel shop in the desert, it doesn't get much better.  Great selection of fresh bagels (I love the Salt w/ lox).    The service is quick and friendly, and the decor has local flavor you wont find at any big chain.  The owners really turned this place around about 4 years ago.  Now it is a thriving local hangout for the active adult in Ahwatukee.  In fact, they attract so many road bikers, a bike shop opened next door last year.

My boyfriend and I tried this cafe because of the ratings and boy did it not disappoint. We got the breakfast grilled cheese and mushroom sausage omelet. These were simply incredible. A lot of food for a great price. The beagles are amazing too. Definitely will want to go and enjoy again next time I'm in Phoenix.
Eating some of the most fresh crepes I've ever had in my life! Hash browns to die for, omelets big enough for two !  Do need to say more!!
Great little place to have breakfast, not big chain food but great quality food! I tend to judge places off the coffee, and it was definitely worth coming back for.
These guys have perfected the bagel and everything else they cook! Wow is the only word to describe them! Thank you Nosh! Your food is just incredible
Tried the veggie bagel sandwich today. Liked it with the fruits side. Potato salad isn't veggie since it contains egg.
Hands down the best breakfast and lunch spot in ahwatukee. The food is amazing and the staff is awesome!!! I love this place.
Not really kid friendly menu, and the food was decent, just not exactly worth the price you pay in my opinion.

The service by the women working the register, the bagel line, and food delivery are all amazing. They all have a great attitude. The manager however, was visibly rude to the workers. The Nosh is known for their bagels and due to managements lack of proper preparation and being proactive instead of reactive, they had almost no bagels. Instead of hyping up his team, you could see him giving them attitude and being frustrated with them. Unfortunate great workers are doing what they can and still doesn't seem to be good enough for their manager.

Food is good, they messed up my order though, for a first timer they don't really explain how it works and waited for my food for over a hour. Being in the food industry I understand but still ridiculous probably not coming back With that kind of wait.
This is my favorite place to get a bagel sandwich! They have amazing prices for the portion sizes! Their pancakes are delicious as well, and are served with almond butter!

Breakfast burritos are big size. I had the South Mountain which was yummy! We also had a side of biscuits and gravy and it was very good. I also ordered an iced coffee, very good. Definitely will be back!

Pretty sweet place for breakfast or brunch, operates in fairly efficient manner, with lots of bagel types, spread types and sandwiches to choose from. They also double as a coffee shop, have patio seating that's great during this lovely fall AZ weather, and their staff is friendly, patient and knowledgeable about their items.  I ordered a toasted everything bagel with jalepeno cream cheese and a chai latte (sm) for a little over $5. I decided to try lox and they added that on for $2 (a 2oz ramekin). My friend and I sat outside on the patio, which was full, and we ended up stuffed in a corner.  Our bagels came out quickly, within 3-4 minutes, but our drinks took much longer. Both of us were already halfway through our breakfast before our chai lattes were brought to our table.  Quality of food matched the price, bagels were good (if not just a little cold), jalepeno cream cheese was SPICY and the lox was... mehhh I don't know if I'd get it again. My friend had a bagel sandwich and he seemed to enjoy that too.  I'd see myself stopping in here pre-IKEA day-long shopping adventure, but I'd like to see the drinks come out at the same time or even before the food.
Tough critic from the East Coast but this was a great spot for a delicious bagel or bagel sandwich. Sad im leaving tomorrow or I would go back again. Sesame bagel with honey but cream cheese= heaven.

I'm very impressed! I got the chicken applewood, spinach scramble and French toast. To quench my thirst, the fresh made orange juice was spot on. The scramble was heavenly, the customer service was friendly and the atmosphere was nice with the convenience of Wi-Fi. I'll be back
Good chef salad and willing to make chicken salad without the bread. Good croutons from bagel chips.

Came in Sunday am and this place was hopping.  They seem to have a lot of regulars.  The hubby and I both had bagel sandwhiches and they were very tasty.  Much better than those at Einstein's... I am pretty sure that place uses powdered eggs.  However, I think I do like the bagels better at Einstein's and they have more flavored cream cheese.  I will probably come to Bagel Nosh again b/c I prefer to support the locally owned businesses over chains but I am not really sure if this place deserves the 4 1/2 stars it currently has.  Maybe part of that is due to my bad experience there.  I ordered a latte with my bagel sandwhich and it took a long time to come out, even after the food.  Then when I finally got it instead of coffee they had given me hot chocolate.  A simple mistake but it can be really jarring when your mouth is expecting one thing and you get another.  Plus I really don't like sugar in the morning and this was extremely sugary sweet.  They did replace it with the latte I ordered but it made me a little grumpy to have to wait so long for my coffee on a Sunday morning so it kind of ruined my day.  I will definitely give them another try and may raise the stars higher in the future.  But I think there are better bagel places in the area.  I LOVE Back East Bagels on Southern and I deeply miss Bruegger's that used to be on Rural and Chandler Blvd - they were the best!

If you're looking for a great breakfast sandwich, this is the place to go to! My husband and I have have tried several ones and none have disappointed. Each bagel sandwich is about $7-$8 but they're a decent size.

Compulsive breakfast decision and I'm happy we chose The Nosh based on other reviews.  I walked in an immediately saw the breakfast enchilada special and decided to order it, They had me at 'green Chile and hash brows'.  My husband ordered 2 grand pancakes which were fluffy and soft, sweet and filled the entire plate.  The service is great and tables were all clean and ready for guests.  For our first time being here we will definitely return.  We ordered 3 breakfast and 2 drinks for $38

Great breakfast, big servings, very clean, good service. The Frittata was excellent, the pancakes are divine. Great variety of dishes to pick from.. The Nosh Cafe will be our regular spot for breakfast! You won't be disappointed.

I remember when this place was bagel nosh and it was the only place to get a good bagel. I must say now that there is competition I find myself disappointed.   I know the place offers more than just bagels now but I haven't had the chance to try them so I will stick to my experience. I regularly order a bacon egg and cheese on an everything (works) bagel. I enjoy the quality but here are my issues. Microwaved eggs. I mean really can we get something that doesn't look like it came from subway's breakfast menu this leaves the "eggs" unevenly cooked usually with a hot spot and a flavor that doesn't make you think fresh ingredients.   The bagel even toasted feels greasy and burned in spots because the toaster that it goes through hasn't been cleaned since the bought it and it flames up sometimes.   I will say I prefer this place over Einstein's any day especially Monday's when the bagel man on 51st/Elliot is closed but my money goes to the bagel man 9 times out of 10 now.  If you want to know what a real bagel should taste like head there instead.

We love The Nosh, in that staff is always very friendly and sweet, we're big customer service people. The food/coffee is great, and we obviously feel good supporting local Ahwatukee small business. We come here all the time and love it.
Ranchero was savory and delicious...don't forget to add some tobacco sauce and ketchup extra tasty when added on the opposite side of the garlic bagel

I love Bagel Nosh!  I go there for Breakfast and Lunch!  Fantastic Menu with lots of variety!    I highly recommend the Dill Garlic Feta Cream Cheese!  It is wonderful and full of flavor.  You wont turn back!  I love this cream cheese on the whole wheat bagel and I also love it on the turkey bagel sandwich!

Came in for lunch and waited in line for 10 minutes. Then our (cold) sandwiches came out almost 30 minutes later, and mine came out wrong. At least if they were taking so long to make it I would have thought they were being meticulous about it... Won't be back.
The long lines are completely worth it. My favorite place to go after an early morning weekend run. Or a later morning hangover. Or any morning at all really.

Great little spot with attentive staff and good food! The decor is inviting and simple, the prices are fair and the food comes decently fast. It's a great casual spot to grab some food. I got the South mountain burrito. It was very filling, with eggs taking up the majority of space. The bacon added a nice smoky flavor, and hash browns added a nice texture. The salsa they served with was great - mild and savory. The coffee was self serve and it did it's job!

I absolutely love this place! It's small and intimate and my favorite neighborhood breakfast place. The food is tasty and the staff is always friendly. The South Mountain Burro is my favorite. It's huge! Very tasty and filling. I love coming and sipping on my coffee and reading here when I have time. My favorite coffee is the Kona and you get unlimited refills, which is always a plus

Probably one of the better bagel shops in town.  Its located inside of a shopping plaza, and easy to find as its right next to a Bashas.  I believe they make thier bagels on site.  Fresh, fresh fresh!  I like that.  They also have a great variety of cream cheeses and bagel flavors to choose from on their menu.    They also have a variety of bagel sandwiches to choose from.  Roast beef, tuna, even LOX!  YUMMY.  They also coffee, and some juices and pop as well.  Yippie!  What else I like about this place, is that its just not bagels.  They also have a variety of pastries to choose from, like muffins, and other stuff too.  What else I like about this place is that there is plenty of outdoor seating.  Thats a bonus! Prices are fair and reasonable, and service was fine.  Worth a try if your in the area.

This place is amazing.  The biscuits and gravey are my go to almost every time I walk in to that place.  Anybody who goes there needs to try this!   The breakfast burrito is a close second.  Having these two items on the menu makes me think gaining weight and eating both may be worth it.    The bagels are a great way to go as well.  They have very good cream cheese and the bages are always very fresh.

When I came here, I witnessed very unprofessional behavior on behalf of the manager at the time. The way the employees were treated was very disrespectful and unbecoming, and I will not be returning. Sad!

So I went to The Nosh today. The service was very slow and the girl who took my order was very rude to not only me, but also her coworkers. People who came in after us got their food faster and it has taken over 40 minutes just to make a bagel and a side of bacon. I am very unimpressed with this restaurant and will not be coming back.

Just tried this place yesterday & I am in love. I ordered a cheese bagel with sweet habanero spread. It was the yummiest thing ever!! I sadly didn't get to try it until I got to work and by then it was cold but still delicious. It was so good I went back this morning and ordered it again! This time I ate it on my way to work. So yummy when it's warm and toasty! I will probably be back tomorrow and will try to make myself try something new. There are a lot of options!   While I am in love with the bagel, the coffee was just meh. One review on here mentions that the mocha is better than Starbucks. I would have to disagree. Tried the latte today and was also not impressed. I like my coffee to be more on the sweet side though.  Also the older woman who is mentioned in another review is just as you described: short with words and grumpy. It's kind of a turn off but when the bagel is that good I will put up with it!   I don't like the debit card machine and the place to tip. I feel obligated to tip every time because they just look at you waiting for your response. I don't mind tipping but if I'm just getting a to go order is it really necessary?

FAVORITE breakfast spot, the lox and jalapeño bagel is GLORIOUS. Iced Americano with cream is strong but smooth. The staff is always so friendly, and all the food I've seen looks phenomenal. My go to.
If your oven is being installed and most of your menu can't be made, close for the day.

Really good bagel breakfast sandwich. They loaded on the bacon, it was perfectly cooked, and the jalapeno cheese bagel I picked it to be on had a nice flavor. Only downfall was that the food took forever to come out. Vistied on a Sunday morning around 10.

I really wanted to like this place. When placing our order, the lady had trouble inputting the prices. She seemed all over the place and said she is just ready to be closed for the day. The place closed at 2 and we got there at 130. This was not the issue though.   I ordered the country omelet. The description seems enticing. It was served with hash browns, but theres also hash browns in the omelet. There was sausage inside as well as cheese. It was covered in a sausage gravy. I was looking forwarded to this gravy, but it was tasteless. Just the first bite of the omelet was just lack luster. The dish only improved once I put ketchup, and I don't usually like to use ketchup. But this seemed like a necessity.   I also ordered a chicken soup. The chicken noodle soup was the best item I tried there. It was very chunky and had flavor. It wasn't the best chicken noodle soup I've had, but it was definitely better than the country omelet, in my opinion.   The coffee was good too.

If your like myself a bagel loving New Jersey Jew then this place will satisfy the craving for a great bagel.Big fluffy and crunchy at the same time and adding the cream cheese and lox will only cost you 9.00 so a good deal too

A great breakfast and brunch place. Their menu offers everything from pancakes to bagel sandwiches. Their homemade bagels are fresh and fluffy. They stuff their bagel sandwiches to the max and their breakfast burritos are the same way. Yummy!

Not familiar with the area and found on yelp.  So glad! A great breakfast, fresh, good quality, large portions! A friendly staff helpful in my egg whites no meat choice. Lots of variety of bagels baked fresh daily! A delish way to start our day!

Basis for my starred ratings (which skews heavily to the food or drink): 1 star:  Never again. 2 stars:  Poor food, poor experience, extraordinary measures in order for me to come back. 3 stars:  Average, nothing really special, nothing particularly bad. 4 stars:  Very good, would definitely return. 5 stars:  A favorite, one of the best.  The food here is barely above 3 stars, more like 3.5.  I've rated this place a 4 for reasons I'll list a little later.  I like independent breakfast joints.  They usually have something special or different that the big chains lack.  Like I said, the food here is generally 3.5-level.  There are a lot of microwaves here. But it bumps up to a 4 for a the following:  the bacon here is thick and good, the coffee was also solid, they have hash browns that are served crispy, and they have the "Not So Common" - a plate with 2 eggs, hashbrowns, and an order of biscuits and gravy.  I've never seen this combo at any other place as a plate, and it's $8.  It's almost all my favorite breakfast foods on a single plate, and this alone almost warrants the bump to 4 stars.  The pancakes here are average.  The hashbrowns taste average.  The biscuit was ok.  Ordered a plain bagel, untoasted, with cream cheese.  Can't even compare this thing to NYC or Montreal or some other bagel joints - it was not that good.  BUT, all those things listed above, bring up the rating.

This place is amazing! I wish one was closer to me. I would stop here everyday before work. I visited The Nosh on a Saturday. And fell in love with all the bagel selection. The service was fast and the crowd of people drew me in.   I ended up with a breakfast bagel that had eggs/bacon and cheese. It was amazing! I thought they would only put like 2slices of bacon. They loaded my bagel with bacon and I was in Heaven. The prices are very reasonable and the staff is very nice. One staff even came from behind the counter to help me hunt down some grape jelly that had ran out. I recommend this place to everyone! I hope they expand the business! I will actually be making a trip to The Nosh this weekend! A+++++
AMAZING food and wonderful service. I have no complaints about this place. One of the best French dip sandwiches I've ever had and their breakfast is wonderful. I will definitely be a loyal customer.

This was our first visit to The Nosh, and we really enjoyed it.   I had a breakfast sandwich that consisted of scrambled eggs, bacon, and cheddar cheese on a garlic bagel. They put a lot of bacon on the sandwich. It wasn't as crispy as I prefer, but I still enjoyed it. I also had an iced coffee, which was pretty good.  The people in front of us in line seemed to have several questions, which made our wait a bit long but it also gave us a chance to really study the menu and choose which bagels we wanted so we knew exactly what we would be ordering once it was our turn.   The food took a bit longer than I would have liked, but it was a busy Saturday mid-morning, so it wasn't a big deal.

Hello to all you foodies out there!  Been looking for a good Bagel place in the area, because as we all know, bagels are an essential part of life.  We know what the chain bagel places are all about....ok bagels and lousy cream cheese...so I am happy to say Bagel Nosh has some superior cream cheese.  Since this review is about finding a good bagel place, I guess we should start with the bagels.  There is a nice variety of bagels but alas....no egg bagel.  boooooooo  To me, the bagels are similar to the kind you buy in a grocery store bakery area...they are not dense(as I grew up with in Chicago or even New York) but almost fluffier, but they are still good.  So much for the bagels...let get to the cream cheese!    The cream cheese is creamy and thick but not too thick and very flavorful.  When enjoying their bagel and cream cheese sandwich it is safe to say it is the cream cheese that you notice.  I will continue to search for the type bagel I enjoy and in the meantime I will continue to enjoy Bagel Nosh.  I would also like to mention the service is great and the employees are wonderful and very friendly and that alone will bring me back!  Keep up the good work.  I think you should check this place out and in the meantime....  Bon Appetite'

I've never been a huge fan of bagel sandwiches. I've always preferred just getting a toasted bagel and cream cheese when I frequent a bagel shop. However, the Nosh Bagelry not only has really, really good bagels and cream cheese (with lots of flavors to choose from for both), they also have affordably-priced and delicious bagel sandwiches. My husband and I tried the Nosh Veggie sandwich and the Nosh French Dip. The Veggie was standard but delicious, with veggie cream cheese and a bagel of my choice (I chose onion, naturally), and for only $4.99, I also got potato salad and a pickle. I know the French Dip ($5.99) sounds strange on a bagel, but it was surprisingly really good. The roast beef was decent, and the garlic bagel he chose added a little something special. One delicious touch was that the bagel was buttered; this, along with the au jus, made it rich and flavorful. I will definitely return here for either breakfast or lunch if I'm in the area.

Great breakfast. Friendly people. Good atmosphere. The dill feta cream cheese is amazing! And they have good wifi. If you don't like what you ordered or it's too salty they are very kind about remaking it. They know how to cook a good egg btw ... most places I got can't make an over medium egg.
Great lunch spot. The tombstone wrap is absolutely delicious although they did make the portion slightly smaller it was for the best. Free wifi is great too.

Having just arrived in the Phoenix area, we were looking for a breakfast location to get vacation started.  I turned to Yelp, and Nosh popped up as one of the top rated spots near us.    They have a wide variety on their menu.  You can go for a scramble, omelette, breakfast sandwich, or something as simple as a bagel.  I decided on the chicken sausage scramble, and I was not disappointed.  The portion was much larger than I expected.  Eggs, chicken sausage, spinach, and cheese all combined in one tasty dish.  They didn't skimp on the meat, which was much appreciated.    Not only was the food tasty, but the prices were super reasonable considering the massive amount of food you get.  Definitely recommend it.  If we had locations in TN, there's no doubt I would be a breakfast regular.
I liked this place. An around the corner cafe. Nothing fancy - a good egg sandwich and a nice variety. Place was clean and friendly

Fresh Bagel sandwiches are the best! Coda B was obviously still under the influence when he wrote his review because there is no " $7 Arizona Classic" here. All breakfast sandwiches are less than $5 and come with heaping portions of eggs and meat/cheese of your choice. Lunch is also served anytime with mounds of turkey, ham, bacon, or my favorite the "Nosh French Dip" roast beef. Fresh brewed tea is fantastic. You are always greeted with a smile. You are treated like family when you walk in. Thanks for all the great bagels!!

This place is always great.  The quality of food is excellent (especially their bagels), there is hardly ever much of a wait, and the people working there are super friendly.  I go here for breakfast or lunch at least once a week.  I love the Tombstone Wrap, but you gotta be careful with that spicy cream cheese they use!

The breakfast burrito never disappoints and the kids love the pancakes. Nice selection of coffee and bagels keeps everyone in the family satisfied. A little pricey but the food quality is good. For Ahwatukee it's probably 5 stars but sine there are better places around Phoenix its a 4. They should expand into a bigger space as this places gets crowded in a hurry.

Very clean place but if it's your first time they don't tell you that you need to get silver ware prior on your own. Food was awesome and service was great. Very friendly and respectful, it was like they new me.  Defiantly recommend this place. Great place to take a computer and do work or just grab breakfast.   Update... I came in on a Saturday morning. Waited 23 minutes for my food to only come out wrong. Avocado toast.... didn't know it was hard....

Great environment, friendly service, and good prices. I got the The Cheerful Breakfast which is 1 egg, hash browns, 1 pancake, and bacon, sausage link, ham. I'm not a big fan of ham so I go it with Bacon, a side of Sausage, and an extra egg with cheese.   Everything was amazing. The Pancake was one of the best I've ever had, only downfall for me was the butter. It had walnuts mixed in which is creative but I'm not a big fan of nuts. But the butter was very flavorful and after I scraped off the but I was good to go.   This was my first time here and the menu had a lot of great options. But my first time places I try to stick with something traditional, if they mess that up I won't be back for the complex or special. I recommend it to everyone ASAP!   I will be coming back soon to try the lunch menu.

I AM IN LOVE WITH THE PLACE!! I get the South mountain burrito but substitute avocado instead of the bacon and it is delicious. I would defiantly recommend this place to friends and have already!! Friendly and fast service as well everyone always has a smile! A great way to start the morning off!!

Found this breakfast/brunch spot on YELP, of course.  First time I came in, I ordered a bagel with strawberry cream cheese. Nothing special, but they do make their bagel and cream cheese! Which, I liked because it was freshly made.   The second time I came in, I saw the Green Chile Burrito! Which looked amazing, so I needed to try it. It comes with chorizo, that I substituted for steak instead.   OHHHH MY GOODNESS. When I took the first bite, it all just melted in my mouth. The green chiles, eggs, hash browns, steak, beans, and all the yummy goodness hit all my taste buds. It was just a special they were having on the weekends that was so popular that they are adding it to the menu now. The green chile was not spicy, to me. It might be for others. I highly recommended trying the Green Chile Burrito.

Great bagels, freshly made! Also, the Pancakes are fluffy, large and delicious. And on my last visit I finally tried the Wraps and those are outstanding too!  This is my favorite place to grab food after a run, hike or race on weekends :)  Dog friendly patio too :) :)

Nosh is a nice breakfast spot.  These got dam fresh bagels tho.  I'm loving the sweet options including egg whites and turkey or chicken sausage, variety of cream cheeses including low fat but I usually just go with the egg white sandwich.  Great food.
this is a great family-run bagel shop. They remember your name after only a few times in and the bagels are always fresh. good coffee and the lox is good. I have nothing but good things to say here.

Best breakfast sandwiches  by far!  they have a good selection of bagels and choices/combinations of ingredients to please anyone's cravings. normally we get the bacon, egg and cheese breakfast sandwich on an everything bagel with salt n butter, it is to die for! We  also get the go bananas..monkey... something like that, it is loaded with bananas, pb and honey, we like it on a chocolate chip bagel.  the only flaw is that they do run out of bagels and you do have to wait a bit to get your order, once you have it, it is worth it, but be ready to wait.
Not bad. I went with Dr Sarah for brunch one Sunday and had a build your own frittata and a bagel. It's hardly phenomenal but it's a good option for brunch.
Great bagels, always baked fresh. Lots of other brealfast and lunch items on the menu. Staff is always friendly. I come here regularly and have never been disappointed.
Amazing breakfast!  Get anything you want -  everything is great.  Juat make sure you get a side of pancakes.  They're perfection.

You havent lived until you've tried one of their pancakes!! The service is great, the line never takes too long and the food is amazing. You can tell the owner goes above and beyond with his employees, creating dishes for the menu, and making sure customers feel welcomed. Cute breakfast spot that will become a morning tradition.

$9 for a lox and bagel sandwich, $9 freaking dollars.  That being said, I came here due to the Bagel Man being closed on Mondays and this place not my jam.  I ordered a reg bagel with garlic/dill/feta cream cheese and it was just ok.  The bagel was chewy but not good chewy, like sticks to your teeth chewy.  It was worth a shot.

The Nosh is ok.  Bagels are mediocre, nothing special.  The older lady who works behind the counter should stay at home.  She's short worded, unwelcoming, and flat out rude to customers.  If you want a real bagel with friendly service there is a much better place up the street on Elliot.  However, if you want an Einstein's copy with Darth Vader behind the counter, come to The Nosh.
Best brunch in a long time! We will be back. Everything was real good. I had the Country Omelet, which totally hit the spot. More than reasonable pricing as well.

This is my second time coming here and being completely satisfied. We came in around 10am when it was slightly busy. Despite this, service, food, and coffee was spot on. I ordered the 2 x4 (2 eggs, your choice of meat, bread, and hashbrowns) and my husband ordered the hog wild on pumpernickel with the cartel coffee. It was delicious and service was fast. There is plenty of seating inside and outside so there were no concerns for seating.   I would definitely come again!
First time here... And let me tell you... So very yummy!!! I spent more then I wanted to, but I was happy. The food, coffee and staff were great.
Great bagel place!!! The breakfast sandwiches are on point!! The staff is always friendly and efficient. Give it a try you won't be disappointed. It's the best bagel spot in the Tuke.

What a cute little local bagel shop in Ahwatukee! I came here with a group of students, and the Nosh was more than accommodating! I called about 30 minutes before we arrived and the employees gladly set up a large table for our group outside. Further, they were so patient and kind to my students. The food was decent and well priced. I had a bagel egg sandwich with bacon for around 6$... not bad at all. They even cooked my egg over medium... fantastic! I would highly recommend the Nosh!

I love the Nosh. This place has an awesome selection of bagels and cream cheese flavors. They also have a hot grill for those who prefer omelets, breakfast burritos and egg dishes. My go-to combo is their garlic feta dill cream cheese on their everything bagel. Gotta try their Kona Macadamia coffee too. Delicious!

I recently visited The Nosh Cafe for breakfast and was impressed with the friendly staff and lack of wait times (even when they were busy).   I chose  the South Mountain Burro which hit the spot perfectly. Tasty and filling but not so much that I felt like a lead balloon afterwards!  The most important thing for me was the coffee. Delicious house coffee - apparently roasted locally so that's a winner :).

Really had high hopes for this place especially upon arrival. It's hidden which is fine and great location for lots of traffic. Walking to the door you can see the line out the door which means great things always.   Come to find out we were wrong here. Menu and everything looked great till, where it went wrong was after ordering our food.  Drinks came out at a reasonable time, but the smoothie tasted watered down and with frozen strawberries that tasted like they been in the freezer for awhile.    As busy as they were they were completely unorganized.  Even with what it looked like 6 people behind the counter and 4 of them cooking it took at least 30 minutes maybe longer just to get our food.   Food arrives was thinking heck this looks amazing maybe I'll rethink the wait for the food.  Nope not one bit, about to take a bite of my food notice a hair probably nothing big but being mad waiting of course it's now a big deal. Tell the lady about didn't seem apologetic just asked what I wanted to go so I got a bagel so I didnt have to wait.  Then my fiancé's food she couldn't finish it tasted like they threw a handful of salt on the potatoes.    After leaving we started reading google reviews, should of read those first.  The way the manager replied made it look like he doesn't care about the customers and just wants there money.   Enter at your own risk but we will no longer be coming here

Visiting from out of town for spring training and we ended up eating here every morning cuz the food and service were amazing!!!!! The food taste fresh, homemade, and a lot of healthy options!!! Would definitely recommend this place for anyone in search of a healthy, hearty breakfast with incredibly nice employees!!!!!!

Best breakfast and lunch place in Ahwatukee.Bagels are fresh and second to none, the schmears are homemade and phenomenal, and the pancakes, eggs and sandwiches are the best. Customer service is great, and quality is consistent. Love this place.
Stopped in after MTB south mountain. My boyfriend and I both had the churizo burro and it was great. Not too busy food was served in about 10mins.

I do not give one stars unless the service truly sucked a two is what I can offer only because I went to this place on my lunch hour and it took over 45 mins for me to get french toast which I did not get to eat until I got home for the day and by then the french toast was nasty tasting like over cooked eggs. I cannot tell you what it tasted like while it was still fresh. If I go back to this place it will be when I have nowhere to go and time on my side

We visited The Nosh Café while in town for a conference and used Yelp to find something nearby. Great find! The food here is absolutely wonderful. Be prepared for standing in line for a bit though - a good sign. In fact, once I saw the line, I knew that we picked the right place. We surely did!

This place has great food. Definitely one of our favorite local spots...so why only 3 stars??? They ALWAYS mess up our order. I rarely write reviews but we ordered breakfast to go today and our order was wrong again. This is our third order in a row that has been incorrect. Get it together, Nosh!   Would I recommend the Nosh?...absolutely. I would just advise you to triple check your order.

Great breakfast place! After years of driving by im so glad I stopped in - had a great selection and was packed. All the workers were friendly and efficient and the bagels were fantastic! Will definitely be going again soon :)

We went to the nosh because we heard they had great hash browns. As you can see from my pictures they were probably the worst I have ever had. The food took a long time to come out and was definitely not worth the wait. We will not be returning.
To update, I've since been to this cafe several times.  It's been a good experience each and every one of them. To the staff in the front and the back of the house, thank you.

I have been coming to [Bagel] Nosh since they first opened here over a decade ago. Came in for a late (11:30) breakfast the other day and the grill had just closed but they still made me the bacon and eggs I came in for. The eggs were cooked perfectly over medium, no runny whites. Love that they have supplemented their bagel business with legit breakfast foods.   Good prices, good portions, good food. Can't really go wrong here and yes, the bagels are really good too. 4/5

Great brunch spot on the go or eat in. They have first come first serve bistro tables out front that are perfect in non-Summer weather. Quick walk from South Mountain if you need a nice spot after a great hike.

Good little cafe for breakfast, can be crowded but it's pretty fast.  I ordered the french toast and veggie omelette. Got the chai tea. Omelette was alright, nothing special but it hit the spot. The french toaat was soft and amazing. Still love hillside a lot more but definitely will come back for the toast!

i've been here quite a few times and it was delicious but after this time i will not return. my boyfriend and I both ordered the grilled steak skillet that was 9$ each. it took about 20 minutes in the first place but then by the time we got it, it literally had 5 pieces of steak!!!!! and then the eggs were super nasty, almost like they were cheap eggs! so I complained because this unacceptable for the price we payed and it didn't have the same consistency from the last time I had it. they made us more steak but by the time we got it we were already finished with our food... never coming back.
Great food, but sooooooo Islow.  Very chaotic and disorganized.  It literally hurts me too go there.
The best place for lox and bagels. The owner works is tail off to make this place a success. I highly recommend this place but get there early. It gets crowded fast as most good places do.

Yum! Stumbled upon this place while looking for a breakfast spot in the area.   Delicious cold brew from Cartel with a variety of flavored syrup options and several creamers.   Lots of menu items for both breakfast and lunch. I opted for a bagel breakfast sandwich which was a generous portion. Came with lots of eggs and bacon and it was toasted perfectly.   Dog friendly patio. Lots of seating. Clean interior.   Only thing that wasn't top notch was that the employee at the front counter taking my order wasn't particularly friendly.   If I lived closer this would probably be a regular spot I'd hit up to try different menu items.
